name: White Chocolate and Raspberry Muffins
keywords: Muffins, White Chocolate, Raspberry, Dessert, Snack, Baking, Easy, Moist, Delicious, Gathering, Family Recipe, Quick Baking, Homemade, Bakery, Sweet Treat, Fruity, Simple Baking, Party, Teatime, Moist Muffins, Breakfast, Brunch, Easy Baking, Dense, Flavorful, Weekend Baking, Yummy, Tasty, Home Baking, Raspberry Muffins, White Chocolate Chunks, Bakery-Style, Baking Tips, Classic Recipe
description: Delicious moist muffins that are great for a snack or gathering.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 180Â°C. Grease or line a 12 muffin tray ready for the mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk the flour, baking powder and baking soda together in a large bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine dry ingredients

recipeInstructions.text: In a separate bowl whisk the melted butter, oil, sugar, and eggs together until combined well. Whisk in the sour cream, milk, and vanilla extract until the mix turns a pale yellow.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine wet ingredients

recipeInstructions.text: Pour your wet ingredients into the bowl of dry ingredients and fold together until just combined, don't overmix. It should be nice and thick. Then fold in the chocolate chips and raspberries.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine wet and dry ingredients

recipeInstructions.text: Pour your batter into the muffin tray dividing it equally. Sprinkle with a bit of sugar to form a nice crust on the top when it bakes. Bake for roughly 25-30 minutes or until golden and set. Clean toothpick/skewer means done.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake

recipeInstructions.text: Allow to cool to room temperature before serving and enjoying!
recipeInstructions.name: Cool and serve

notes: Experiment increasing the amount of wet ingredients to create a denser muffin
